text:
hey <@U0260V4K1>	and <@U02E3CRMA>	I noticed Josh tagged some questions in the Google-SOW version.  Can y’all keep this doc open ahead of tomorrow’s call?  These are the points that will inform the conversation.

<https://docs.google.com/a/google.com/document/d/1PE71Yv01xVUmsIc1dJstdZOV6Bw9ETjXLsL8_Zmxsk4/edit?usp=sharing>

Right now three points I’ve responded to:
1.  Google wanted to ensure that, while this is web app hosted on AppEngine, that the code would be integrated with Showtime as well.  *I confirmed it would and tagged Joel.*
2.  Josh thinks that handoff documentation should be more robust than a one sheet and asks if there is more anticipated in a subsequent phase. I’m clarifying: *There are no subsequent phases planned yet and thus no post-launch work identified or associated with subsequent phases.  Given that we’re building an app on existing hardware, the idea is that the project documentation (mocks, TDD etc) we produce + an addendum to the existing Exhibit hardware should suffice since things like power on/off, exhibit maintenance should already exist in DF documentation. *
3.  Josh has questions around the progression of our deliverables asking how Motion Study, UI Design and Playtesting happen before TDD.  *My understanding is that the TDD is more of a collation of the produced project documentation.  Meaning we’d need UI design, intended functionality agreed upon before we can codify the TDD deliverable.  Is this of-base given what we learned on Cubby Wall project?*
<@U0ML49XU0|dennishanley> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/dennishanley/F3EB7A1A6/net_contributor_map_sow|Net Contributor Map SOW>
